item.description: Playing Amigos helps you to get to know your friends even better. During each round a player takes a card from one of the three piles (Action, Fantasy or Psycho pile) and reads the question on the card to one of the other players who has to answer this question. The other players have to judge the answer. You don't have to tell the truth when you give the answer, the only thing that matters is that the others believe it. He who scores best in this part of the game will end up as the winner.

Players are director of a bank and will invest in products, develop and bring them to the market.

At the beginning of the game everyone receives a card which states which products are to be purchased. With some starting money and one first random product, every turn dice are rolled and paws moved. The board shows all available products, and whenever the player lands on a product space he can either buy it, or must pay the current owner.
Besides product cards there are positive and negative cards which must be drawn when landing on the subsequent space.
The winner is the one who first succeeds to collect the products on his card.

This game was released in 1997 at the 100th anniversary of the Rabobank in The Netherlands. All cards and components are Dutch.

An abstract games played with chess pieces on a rotated chess board. There are two kind of pieces, Kings and Jacks. The object of the game is either to capture the opponent King or to reach the opponent "King Triangle" i.e. the opponent's home base.

name.value: Tracks: The Unique Railroad Quiz Game

item.description:
A trivia game about railroads. Players roll a die marked with the letters T, R, A, C, K, and S and answer questions in the corresponding categories: T=Early Railroad History, R=Lingo, A=Famous Names and Places, C=Technical Data and Reporting Marks, K=Passenger Trains and Logos, S=Pot-Pourri (sic).

Correct answers are worth 5 points. Whether a correct answer is made or not, a player's turn is over after they answer.
The game can end one of two ways. First, if a player can roll the letters in the same sequence as the title on their turns (and successfully answer the corresponding questions), they win the game upon the completion of answering the last question. Since this will prove to be rather rare, the first player to reach 50 points wins.

The game questions can also be used with Trivial Pursuit or other trivia games.

The game's box includes the aforementioned die, 500 cards with 3,000 questions (500 from each category), rules, a category summary sheet and a surprisingly large amount of information on the cover artist (in spite of the game including no information on the actual designer of the game).

A strategic-level game on the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902.

One turn = one month
One hex = 15 miles
One strength point = 500 men (British), 333 men (Boers)

Components: one standard-size game map, one sheet of counters, and a rule book.

Scenarios include the Traditional War, the Guerrilla War, and the Campaign Game.

The game was included with the 3W game The Defense of Rorke's Drift, but is a completely separate game.

ONE MUST OBTAIN THE DEFENSE OF RORKE'S DRIFT GAME IN ORDER TO GET THIS GAME.

This version of baseball was produced in 1941 by Milton Bradley. It is a physical dexterity game that uses a thick cardboard bat about 3.4" long, with a wood semi-circle glued to the underside about 1/3 in from the handle, and with a small hole near the tip of the bat. There are 8 small glass balls, 4 white and 4 black. The cardboard playing field is inset into the box bottom, and is punched with a variety of holes.

The rules on the side of the box say that when batting, a player puts the bat about 2" from the home-plate corner of the box, mounts a ball of his color on the hole in the bat, and then brings down his finger with a sharp blow to the bat handle. This launches the ball up and onto the playing field. Falling into one of four large oblong holes around the pitcher's mound is a strike. Dropping into the round hole near each fielder is an out. Dropping into any of the numbered holes is a safe hit of that many bases. There is a home run hole in deep center field. If a launched ball fails to fall into any of the holes, it is a ball. Three strikes cause an out, while four balls of course generate a walk. Successful hits are marked by putting balls into holes on the appropriate bases before batting again.

The game can be found listed in "Baseball Games from Antique Baseball to Modern Baseball Sims".

Objective 1: Be the first to finish all missions.
Objective 2: Avoid the Thumb Thumbs!
Objective 3: Become the ultimate OSS spy!

In this advanced Spy Kids board game, you are working as an OSS spy to help solve important missions.

Control the OSS operatives as they work their way around from mission to mission as quickly as possible. This is no time for fooling around. The Thumb Thumbs are a serious threat to take over the world! They have stolen secret documents, planted booby traps, invaded sensitive buildings, and have created chaos everywhere. The OSS team needs YOU to help stop the Thunb Thumbs!

Be the first to complete every mission and become the ultimate OSS Spy! Work quickly and find the fastest route to each targeted mission. Be on the look-out for the evil Thumb Thumbs, who have been sent out to stop you from saving the world.

Quest of Efil is played on three boards, each at a different scale. One board shows a world map, one is for arranging a group of dungeon-like mazes, and the third is for tactical battles. Players take on a role, each described on a character card. These include a hero, a wizard, a master thief, a dwarf king, a cyborg, and a ninja.

Players complete a series of quests, each of which has the aim of collecting an item to be used in defeating the final enemy. Quest of Efil has been awarded US Patent number 5476264.

Go Diego Go! Treasure Quest is a roll and move game where each player is trying to collect a "Play Scene Board" which is a picture of a location like a desert or waterfall. Once all the players collect a Play Scene Board and make it to the Treasure Chest to find Baby Jaguar, the Play Scene Boards are used to create stories using Colorforms Stick-Ons of Diego and his pals.

Up to 4 captains try to lead their ships into their harbor. But there is some danger of being bombed. And the wind has to blow in the right direction...
This is one of the big boxes of Clipper. It contains beautiful material, such as ships and windroses.

From the box: A speedy spooky numbers game!

Mr and Mrs Morbid are throwing their annual Halloween party. As usual they've invited some very strange guests... and you've been given the job of answering the door to them all!

You've got to keep track of how many peculiar characters arrive and leave because Mr and Mrs Morbid have invited more spooks that their creepy house can hold!

You can't turn any guests away, but you're in trouble if you let more than 99 guests in!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
From the box: A mad game of well-mannered monster mayhem!

General Gargoyle has a strange collection of pets. They are some of the weirdest looking creatures you have ever seen. General Gargoyle sometimes has a bit of trouble controlling his crazy creatures - it's the third time this week that the monsters have sneaked out, and the General has enlisted your help to catch them all, for which he is offering a reward!

So catch as many monsters as you can! But beware, the reward that the General is offering is extremely generous, so others will be trying to capture the monsters too!

Notes on game from publisher:

This entertaining and captivating word-building game includes 100 plastic tiles in 9 bright colours, representing all of the common letter groupings. Players will discover that words are built with different letter patterns that represent different units of sound. Unique 2-tiered tile racks provide up to 4 players with workspaces to create their own words in preparation for play. Tiles include consonants, consonant digraphs, consonant clusters (blends), short vowels, long vowel digraphs and r-controlled vowel digraphs. The colour coding of each tile separates these letter groups in accordance with the Smart Phonics system.

"Trifecta…you betcha'!" ESPN 21st Century Trivia brings your favorite sports indoors with 21st Century sports trivia questions and fast-action game play including Chalk Talk and Instant Replay challenges to get your head thinking and your heart pumping.

"He shoots…he scores!" Beat the shot clock as you battle your opponents, race around the board and win the game. "You…could…go…all…the…way" by answering 1,000 questions about your favorite sports like football, skateboarding, BMX racing, baseball, college and more!

Get your adrenaline rush by picking a "Chalk Talk" card and sketch sports terms like "Kiss the glass", "Snow cone" or "Half pipe"; or pick an "Instant Replay" card and act out "Hail Mary", "No look pass" or "SportsCenter". This game's "got more flavor than Kool-Aid and cocoa!" "Boo-yah!"

Game includes 1,000 trivia questions, 150 "Talk Chalk" and "Instant Replay" challenges, stopwatch, game board and 4 movers.

Travel back to New York's golden age of gangsters, where you get to take on the role of a crime boss in 1950's Little Italy. Make your rounds about town as you pick up money from different buildings, but watch out for the "heat"!

Each crime boss shares control of two cars, each with a different opponent. Drive through the streets, timing it right to collect money and avoid the police.

Play strategically, and you'll be able to drive your opponents straight into a stakeout, costing them big money while you collect the big score. If you don't, you'll find yourself sleeping with the fishes!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Bait Bazi is a verbal game and a genre of Urdu poetry played by composing verses of Urdu poems. The game is common among Urdu speakers in Pakistan and India.

The game starts with the first person reciting a stanza of a poem. The next player has to reply with another verse starting with the last letter of the verse used by the previous player and so on.

A verse that has already been used in a game may not be repeated. The rules used by experienced players can be more stringent, such as allowing the use of only one poet's verses or of one theme.

Sic bo, also known as tai sai, dai siu, big and small or hi-lo, is an unequal game of chance played with three dice, and of ancient Chinese origin. Grand hazard and chuck-a-luck are variants, and of English origin. The literal meanings of sic bo, tai sai and dai siu are dice pair or dice bowl, lucky dice and big small respectively.

Sic bo is a casino game, popular in Asia and widely played (as dai siu) in casinos in Macau. It is played in the Philippines as hi-lo. It was introduced into the USA by Chinese immigrants in the early 20th century, and can now be found in most American casinos. Since 13 May 2002, it can be played legally in licensed casinos in the United Kingdom.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
The name means 'Ox' in Cantonese. It is a card game originating in Malaysia, played both casually and as a gambling game. The game uses a standard deck of 52 cards.

Players are dealt 5 cards each, and players try to get the better hand. A hand is constructed when 3 cards form points that is a multiple of 10. This constitutes an 'Ox'. The remaining 2 cards show how powerful is the 'Ox'. The power is determined as the remainder of the sum of the 2 cards, divided by ten.

When a player is not able to form an 'Ox' with any 3 cards, then he is not eligible to score any points in the round.

Giog uses Xiangqi Pieces but no board. All players help to scramble the 32 pieces face down and distribute the pieces evenly to themselves. If the number of players is three, the winner of the previous game or a volunteer receives 12 pieces and the other two players receive 10 pieces each. Like a Mahjong game, each player arranges his/her pieces into one line with half of the pieces on top of the other half.

Play is very similar to the Western card game 'Hearts', inasmuch as players reveal pieces in turn and whoever has the highest ranking piece being the winner. Should there be a tie among some players, they apply the same procedures again by revealing more lower pieces until the order is finally determined.

The player who played the strongest combinations of a same type (as what the round-starter played) wins that round. If there is a tie, the round-starter always wins, or the order of players determines the winner. For example, if the first and fourth player play the same combinations, first player wins unless fourth player is the round-starter. The winner of a round collects the won pieces and starts a new round. The game is played until all pieces are exhausted. The game will go to the player who wins most pieces.

Banqi, or Half Chess, is a two-player Chinese board game played on a 4x8 grid (usually half of the Chinese Chess board). Banqi is a social game, usually played for fun rather than serious competition. Because it has a significant element of chance, some people consider it a child's game, but Banqi often has remarkable depth of strategy.

The 32 pieces are shuffled and randomly allocated face-down to squares on the board. The first player turns up a piece to begin the game. The color of the piece he turns up is the color he will play in the game. The second player then makes a move, and the two alternate until the game is finished.

The game ends when a player cannot move; the player who cannot move loses. Most often, the game is lost because all of a player’s pieces have been captured and so he has no pieces to move. However, it is possible for one player to surround all of the other player’s pieces in a manner that makes it impossible for them to move.

item.description: In Dutch game Afvalwijzer the players have to cope with 6 types of garbage. This could be a bag of chips, an empty package of cigarettes, ... In the centre lies the board with on it twice every location. By using die, the players walk around the board, whenever they get at a location where they can dump their garbage-cards, they can do so. He who manages to get rid of his garbage at the right location before his opponents, wins the game.

Simple card game which has a number of options depending on which card you select. Game comes with Field as part of the Game Box, a set of cards for both players, score sheets, 4 markers to show players on the base paths and an instruction pamphlet.
In Air Trafic, a game published at the end of the '70s or early '80s by Nathan, the players manage an air company. he who earns the most money wins the game.

name.value: Maisy's hide and seek adventure game

item.description:
Help Maisy find her favorite things and then take her to some of her favorite places!

Maisy's Hide and Seek Adventure game is perfect for young children ready to play their fist board game! The simple, easy to follow instructions enables players to practice these important skills:

Color matching - players roll the color die and move to the space that matches the color rolled.

Memory - if they land on a space that pictures an object, they must try to find the chip that contains the matching object. In order to be successful, the player needs to remember where certain objects are hidden!

Taking turns - a child's first game experience teaches cooperation and consideration for others.

Following in sequence - to be successful, the players need to follow their given path and get Maisy to her favorite place.

Cooperating, winning and losing graciously - an important lesson to learn early in life!

There are 3 versions of play that vary in degree of difficulty.

It has copyright 1967 R.G. Bryant

It's an Abstract Strategy game, played on a 16x16 grid, 20 pieces to a side, each on own colour. each corner has a 3x3 area that is not playable.

Pieces can move different amounts as per pre game arrangement. by single squares, by one or two squares, one or 3, one of 4, or one or 5, through open squares only. Moves are diagonally backwards or forward, sideways or circular (not really explained in the rules)

three ways to capture (albeit one would be rare as you have to move into a capture position, they call it a 'blunder')

others are by landing on a square not of your colour (again not easy to see how that happens)

Or by having a piece on opposite sides of an opponent's piece.

The three options sound like designer was trying to add depth with options that will rarely come into play

The copy must be Canadian since it's in both English and French. I am in Canada too.

Box is simple, checkerboard design, with nothing more than name and the copyright info.

pieces are plastic, stamped '220' simple. but nice

name.value: Disney's The Hunchback of Notre Dame Festival of Fools Card Game

item.description:
It's the Festival of Fools and all Paris is a carnival for Quasimodo, Esmeralda and your other friends. You want to get all the heroes together - and keep away from that villain Frollo. When the bells of Notre Dame show up, there'll be big changes in the game. And a Festival of Fools card means one of you may become the King of Fools! (Don't worry, you can undo the spell.) The first player who collects one each of the heroes - Quasimodo, Esmeralda, Phoebus, Clopin, Djali, and the Gargoyles, wins.

Contents: 54 playing cards

Ages 5 and up

G.S.T. The Game!! Have Fun!!

Brian's Biggest Blooper

You hated it!!!
You paid a committee to study it!!!
Now play it!!

3 strikes you're out
3 stripes you're in
Government pays
One Million for painting

Your chance to laugh at the government.

Take the role of one (or more) of 10 different occupations and travel around the board following the instructions in the square you land on. Draw cards, read them out loud, and follow those instructions. You can change occupations in the middle of the game by landing on the Reincarnation square.

A simple game and *very* Canadian-centric.
A guessing a verbalizing children's game where the goal is to collect the most beetles.

This is a dice rolling game which tries to simulate the game of Curling, with simple rules for 2 individual players or 2 teams of players Ages 9 and up. Draws, blank ends, hit and roll, takeouts, peels, steals and more but best of all there’s absolutely no sweeping to do!

This game combines all the thrills of real hockey and is played on a board representing the ice surface. Players are shown in both Red and Blue. The game has two dice and a puck which is moved through squares in the direction and by the distance of what was rolled on the dice. Game appears to feature pictures of both the Montreal Canadians and the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Old Hockey Game. Not much information is available for this game. Board (rink) is marked off in squares and the pawns used to represent players move from square to square depending on a die roll.

The idea behind this game is to simulate the NHL draft and the operation of a team. 6 teams are included in the game Toronto, Philadelphia, Minnesota, Boston, Montreal and New York. the game board is an ice rink with a superimposed chart on it. the chart has 6 columns each representing one of the teams in the game. Object of the game is to allow players to participate in a number of transactions that occur in the NHL such as drafting players at the start of the season and then making changes to the team during the season. There are two decks of cards included, one titled "Starting Team Player Cards" and the other "Standard Player Cards" A third deck is titled "Vouchers" and is used in relation to draft choices. Object is to wind up with the best possible team.

name.value: Double Game: The City of Shadows

item.description:
The "Double Game" series of books uses a combat and inventory system familiar to many "fighting fantasy" style books. But this one allows two players to play simultaneously (each using a different book of the pair). The books use cross-reference tables to allow the players to interact with each other (cooperating or otherwise) at certain points.

One player player plays Coreus, the Prince. The other plays the Bardik, the Thief.

name.value: Double Game: The Glade of Dreams

item.description:
The "Double Game" series of books uses a combat and inventory system familiar to many "fighting fantasy" style books. But this one allows two players to play simultaneously (each using a different book of the pair). The books use cross-reference tables to allow the players to interact with each other (usually cooperating) at certain points.

One player player plays Darian, the Master Magician. The other plays the Issel, the Warrior King.

The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the Dream Works film Shrek 3.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Merlin Card' When you play this card you call out a color of your choice. All other players draw cards from the DRAW pile until each draws a card of that color. All of the cards that they draw are added to the cards in their hands.

name.value: Hustler's The Great American Baseball Game

item.description: A solidly made tin Baseball Game that has a large roller at the top and a very nice graphic representation of a ball field. That roller has a slot at the top of the game that shows results of the at bat depending on what is happening on the field. In other words with runners on 1st and 3rd the results might show a Sacrifice Fly while with nobody on base the results might be a Single.
Boardgame with 6 lead figs 3 U-boots 3 planes, rules in German. Title of the game includes the mis-spelled "Engeland"

extrapolation from 'Play The Game" by Brian Love. Flip-O-Hoy is an aerial race game. It consists of a sky rack divided into stages representing an actual flight. Players advance around the board by spinning the propeller spinner. Different space on the board cause things to happen. Engine Trouble, Air Pockets, Loop the Loop, Fog, Spinning Nose Dive, Forced Landing, and Glide Home either help or hinder your flight.

A chess variant from 2 or 4 players.
Played on a concentric board which allows for "orbiting" movements in addition to the traditional ones.
The aim of the game is to reach the center of the board with the Federation Ship (i.e. the King).

Pieces are named Starfighters, Invaders, Voyagers, Rockets and Shuttles.

Contents
1 board
64 playing pieces;
- 4 Federation ships
- 4 Star Fighters
- 8 Invaders
- 8 Voyagers
- 8 rockets
- 32 shuttles
1 rules booklet

THE PRESIDENT GAME
Super Fun - Super Fashion
When you are not playing it - wear it - it's hot!
(65 % polyester, 35% cotton)

Unfold the game and find the playing surface on the back of a fabulous oversized t-shirt (one size only).

Become the Ultimate Power!
Become THE PRESIDENT!

Players must work their way up 7 levels to finally become THE PRESIDENT but beware of the pitfalls and temptations along the way. Don't get caught committing fraud or end up in a sex scandal. Watch out for assassins!

Chose a running mate or go it alone.
Good luck candidates - you are going to need it.
It's not easy being THE PRESIDENT.
Everyone wants the shirt off your back!!

name.value: Race Around the Clock Elapsed Time Game

item.description: Build confidence in solving elapsed time problems with this self-checking game featuring real-life elapsed time scenarios. The first player to advance around the clock face game board wins!

Primero (Primiera) is an Italian, renaissance-era card game that spread across Europe in the 16th century, becoming favored in the Elizabethan court. It is hand-based wagering game, not too dissimilar to Poker. Like poker, the goal is to have the highest-ranked hand after several rounds of wagering, although the exact rules differed among numerous regional variants (this too, is much like poker). The game is played with a standard deck, with the 8's, 9's, and 10's removed.

From lowest to highest, the four-card Primero hands are as follows:
- Numerus: Two or three cards of any suit. Only the cards from the strongest suit are scored.
- Primero: One card from each suit.
- Supremus: Ace, 6, 7, of one suit (this is the highest-scoring Numerus, but counts as a superior hand).
- Fluxus: Four cards all of the same suit.
- Chorus: Four of a kind.

Some variations exclude the Supremus or Chorus. Ties are resolved by the total value of the scored cards in the hand.

"Generations" premiered at Essen 2000. A party game, its publisher describes it as follows:

Are eating breakfast for hours, wearing large earrings, constant noshing, brown from the tanning booths, hanging out at taverns, or sex in the dark typical of golden oldies, cool teens or busy midlifers?

Over 200 statements, situations and behaviors about the generations demand your vote. What do the generations dream about? Who are their models and idols? Over 100 possible life-styles, desires and trends are available for your personal selection.
Also known as SPIG, developed at Carnegie Mellon University as a means of instructing good engineering practices in software design. Said to be Monopoly-like.

Admiralty is a set of Wargame rules for fighting under sail for the period 1750 - 1815.

It is a rules-set ( 20+ pages ) and does not contain any figures. It's design in relatively simple and designed to allow players field large forces and still maintain realism in their simulations.

This Swedish table soccer game claims to be the only soccer simulating game in the world where players are freely moving. The secret is a Swedish patent that allows a player and the metallic stick, that is used to move the figure under the "grass", to have a magnetic connection that is not disturbed by other sticks or figures. Open/closed 106 x 49,5cm x 6,1cm / 54,5 x 49,5 x 12,2cm, weighs 3,9 kg.

There are five players per side, one goalkeeper, two defenders and two attackers. The goalkeeper and the two defenders can only move on one half of the gaming surface and the attackers on the other half.

This game is similar to Real Hockey

Thlink is the family game of linking by lateral thinking for 2-6 players. Imagination is the key because in this game there are no set answers - it is up to you to link as many of the 16 dealt picture cards to ghe given category as you can. - Taken from the rule book

Thlink is a family friendly party game in which players bid on a the number of "links" they can make between 16 picture cards and 1 category card. Other players have the right to challenge a link and voting determines the outcome.

Take a Wild Guess is an interactive trivia game. It consist of 1,050 trivial questions requiring a number for an answer. The questions are difficult enough so that no one is expected to know the correct answer, but everyone is required to “take a wild guess”. The person reading the question competes against the other players, who work together to arrive at a consensus answer. The interaction between the other players generates conversation and laughter and often a reasonably close guess. Points are awarded to those that are closest to the exact answer and to any answer that falls on or within the “margin of correctness” (50% either side of the exact answer).

There are five categories animals, 19th century America, science, military, and the 21st century.

Sample Question:
During the last Ice Age's coldest stage (approximately 18,000 years ago), the average temperature in what is now Kansas was how may degrees Fahrenheit colder than today?

The correct answer is 18 degrees.

If the reader was closer than the consensus answer of his opponents he receives 1 point for each player. If the consensus answer was closer each player, except the reader, receives 1 point.

Bonus points are awarded if the closest answer falls within the specified margin of correctness. For this question the margin of correctness is 9 degrees to 27 degrees.

Players choose a card representing their monster's body. Each such monster's body can then hold a variable number of heads, limbs and tails (i.e. the blob cannot have a head but can have up to 8 limbs and tails). Each body also provides a special power different from other monsters. Players bid for different cards of body parts, each provides additional powers for your monster.

Players start with 12 dice to allocate among their monster's body parts. The dice indicate the amount of power available to each body part and how much damage it can take.

On each player's turn they can choose to attack with one of their body parts (i.e. laser beams from the head, pincer claw limbs, etc.) rolling the dice from that body part. The player targets an enemy monster's body part, hits cause damage that remove dice from that body part. When a body part runs out of dice it is destroyed. When a monster loses all of its dice it is destroyed. Different powers allow players to reallocate dice and recover dice.

The push-your-luck game Cheeky Monkey includes eight sets of animals – three elephants, four seals, and so on up to ten monkeys – with a plastic chip representing each animal. To start the game, you place all the chips in a bag.

On a turn, a player may draw chips until either (1) he chooses to stop or (2) he draws an animal that he has lying in front of him from a previous draw this turn. In this latter case, he returns all chips in front of him from the current turn to the bag, and the next player then takes his turn. In the former case, he stacks the chips in whatever order he wants on top of any chips he's collected in previous turns. (If a player has animals of only a single type, he can tuck them on the bottom of his stack.) Two special rules come into play while the player draws chips:


 If a player draws an animal chip that matches the animal on top of an opponent's stack, the player can steal this animal, adding it to the chips currently in front of him. (If he busts for drawing a duplicate animal, this stolen chip is also returned to the bag.)
 If a player draws a monkey, he can either keep the monkey (as with any other animal) or he can swap the monkey for the chip on top of an opponent's stack.


When the last chip has been added to a stack, the game ends. Any player who has more chips of an animal type than any other player receives bonus points equal to the total number of that animal in the game. The player with the most points wins.

item.description:
The game is not a variant of poker but a game on his own.
Bet with your tokens or with one of your cards representing various goods: a whisky bottle, act of property, alliance,...
But these will have effects on the game.

From the publisher:

The classic four-in-a-row game with a twist 
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel 
Laugh-out-loud fun for kids -- and adults! 
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones 
 Up and down? Across? Diagonally? Careful -- your opponent already has 3 tokens lined up! Block them, get four in a row, and ta-da -- you win! 


Components:
Includes one Connect-O-Round game tube and 42 tokens (21 of each color).

This game from the Cranium Grab & Go series takes marbles to a new level. Besides allowing regular play, this game also includes rings that, when the marbles land inside, the player must perform to score points.

From the publisher:

The game of marbles with fun Cranium twists 
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel 
Fun for kids -- and adults! 
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones 
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends 
 
Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Mega Marbles!

Play the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like shooting marbles into activity rings to determine whether you'll hum, spell, or act out a clue.

What's in the box?
Mega Marbles includes 22 colorful marbles (20 small and 2 large) and 10 goals.

name.value: Cranium Grab & Go Turbo Tic Tac Toe

item.description: A version of tic tac toe from Cranium. Their rules allow for many variations on the traditional gameplay, such as dice roles, and flipping and swapping pieces. Part of the Cranium Grab & Go series.

From the Manufacturer
Race to build jitterbugs with this unique electronic talking card game! It's your turn to play Bug Hunt! Can you match pieces to build a bug? Quick -- before time runs out -- and don't forget the tail! Race against family and friends to build jitterbugs -- the first person to get four in their collection wins! Cranium Bug Hunt is portable, easy to play, and features an electronic Bug Hunter as the announcer -- it's a card game unlike any you've played before.

item.description: A creative way to "deliver" an understanding of fractions! Seven games offer different levels for learning the values of: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/5, 1/6, 1/8, 1/10 and 1/12. Children practice identifying fractions, matching fraction equivalents and adding and subtracting fractions. Game includes 11 double-sided pizzas (one side is labeled with the fraction) with 59 individual slices, three double-sided spinners and game guide.

name.value: Animals on the Loose: A Beginning Phonics Game for ELLs

item.description: Help beginning-level ELLs build confidence with this appealing animal-themed phonics game. Pictures encourage home language connection as students learn to decode English words. Game questions focus on word beginnings and endings, letter-sound correspondence, rhyming/word families, letter recognition and spelling. The first player to spell his or her word wins. Game includes 209 cards, die, 4 animal game pieces and Activity Guide. Ages 5 - 7

The game consists of 21 coins in a bag (7 additional coins are used as positional markers).

Each coin bears two numbers ranging from 1 to 7 - one number per side. The two numbers are always different.

The coins are thrown on the table and then sorted by the visible numbers.

In his turn a player selects a coin, put it on his side of the table and flips it over.

The first player to reveal all seven numbers on his side of the table wins the game.

Since each coin bears exactly one of the (21) possible combinations of two different numbers from 1 to 7 the players gain more and more information about the numbers still hidden and thus are able to make - quite educated - guesses to select the correct coins.

Online Play


 Edition ErlkÃ¶nig Online Games (solitaire and versus computer opponent)

item.description:
From the website:

" In Endless Monsters Upon Japan! you direct an unstoppable stream of monsters from your home city towards either Tokyo or Hiroshima. One player seeks to reduce the major cities of northern Japan to rubble; the other is against southern Japan.

The monsters are very active, and cause little trouble if allowed to run from city to city. But if delayed at a city they stomp about in frustration and cause great damage. True to the ideals of collectible monster games, the monsters enjoy fighting each other and grow in size with each victory. Moreover, the theme of collectible monster games also led the mad scientists to create three colors of monsters, each of which has an advantage against another.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. Two playing boards are included: a chart makes learning the game simpler, while a map of Japan is prettier to use. There are numerous strategies, some of which will be discovered quickly by an adult player and others of which are more subtle."

From the website:

"Wizards of the Vicious Circle is a two-player game as clever and original as any you will see. Strategy goes beyond moving pieces as players try to out-guess which three of five creatures the opponent will initially deploy, and where. The other two creatures become reinforcements later in the game. The vicious circle (how each of the five pieces can capture only one of the opponent's) interacts with board terrain and initial deployments to make each game uniquely interesting and intriguing."

(From the box): 
1. Each player takes a turn to throw the dice
2. Stack a disc accordingly on top of the playing stack.
 e.g. if a number "2" is thrown, place a disc with its hole over the 2 of the disc on the top of the stack.
3. The player who topples the stack loses.

Contents: 15 Discs and 1 die.

From the website:

"An underground magical labyrinth has several stairway exits, each climbing up to the surface and ending beside a city. The players represent these cities. The goal is to have heroes/heroines exit the labyrinth to your city -- and the more treasure such heroes/heroines carry the better!"

36 balls are evenly distributed into 12 tubes. On your turn, empty a tube and place the balls in the next tubes, one each, going anti-clockwise. If you place a ball in an empty tube on your side you capture that ball and all the balls in your opponent's adjacent tubes.

The winner is the first to capture 19 balls, as there are 36 to start with.

It's a 3D game related to Mancala, but very different in physical style.

item.description:
From the website:

"Alien Checkers is a versatile game. Besides using cards during the game, players select one of nine special cards to secretly find out which planet they are representing: each planet has a different secret victory condition. Children can enjoy how the game is silly and (compared to plain checkers) gives them a better chance of winning when playing their parents. Adults who wish to analyze the game more carefully will notice new flavors of strategy as the cards and secret goals work together."

From the website:

"In Chessboard Heroism you are a hero or heroine, trying to do heroic things before wars break out and your career options are reduced to boring military service. You long to solve real quests: saving people who need rescuing, finding lost magical items, fighting wild monsters, etc. But time is running out! Cards detailing quests cover a chessboard's squares. Solve the quests faster than your opponents while cooperatively maintaining the political stalemate or the game ends! And watch out for the randomly wandering dragon!"

From the publisher:

" Markets and Mercenaries is a simple and quick board game that combines the interesting features of many more primitive "build a colony" computer and board games (resources, buildings, market economics, special events) while excluding features that tend to slow such a game down (exploration, territorial expansion, conquest). The game uses a Monopoly-like path around the board's outer edge allow random events in a way that carefully prohibits luck from overriding strategy.

Players use wise resource management and strategic construction of new buildings to expand their colony. Resources are not only traded among players but bought and sold with the Empire in a market with varying (and manipulatable) prices. The colonies also build up military strength to use at the conclusion of the game when the colonies jointly declare independence and the Empire responds with an invading army. "

The game uses a 6x6 grid as the main playing area. Each player receives a bunch of little plastic pieces and 2 large ones (gnome crystals) with an irregular shape.

The object is to score the most points by the time the game ends, which happens immediately when someone runs out of pieces to play. A point is scored by having a straight or diagonal arrangement of three crystals of the same color, and a large crystal as part of such an arrangement scores 2 points instead of 1. A line of 4 crystals scores twice, once for each "end" of the row.

The game is played by rolling two dice, one for each side of the grid (rows and columns). After rolling the dice, the player places them on the appropriate row and column that matches the die face. Then the player can place a crystal in any empty location on either the row or column indicated. They can also choose to "combat" another player's crystal on the specific intersection of the rolled dice. Combat involves a simple die-off, defender wins ties, with a large crystal providing a +1 bonus to the roll.

Finally, if a player rolls doubles and is able to place a crystal on the intersection (say row 3 and column 3), then they get to roll again.

name.value: UNO: The Simpsons Treehouse of Horror

item.description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the TV show The Simpson's Halloween Specials Treehouse of Horror.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Witchcraft Card - Can be played to counter a Draw 2 or Draw 4 card. Can also be used as a wild card.

Rush is a territory game played with a Go set. Players take turns adding their own stones. Players cannot add a stone which is horizontally adjacent to two or more stones, if all of the connecting stones are the same color as the added stone. If a player adds a stone which forms two or more connections, he must add another stone during his turn, and keep adding stones during his turn until his most recent stone connects to one or less stones, concluding his turn. The object is to have the majority of stones on the board when the board fills up.

item.description:
From the game manual:
Swizzle is an easy to learn but challenging strategy game. Players try to get their chips three-in-a-line. Both players play cards and swizzles to determine where the chips will be played. Be prepared for the fun of unexpected endings in this fascinating game.

name.value: UNO: National Football League NFL Editions
UNO: National Football League AFC Edition
UNO: National Football League NFC Edition

item.description:
The usual Uno rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

These two football themed editions of UNO feature pictures of AFC and NFC stars on the cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Champs Card' - When this card is played, the player who plays it selects another player to draw cards. That player must draw until he has drawn a number 4 card or seven cards total. The player playing the 'Champs Card' also selects the new color of play.

A Brazilian Game designed to Top Models wanna be. Translation from the box:

"Super Model: The Top Models Game
The life of a Top Model is full of glamour, dreams and fantasy... sometimes, it even resembles a fairytale. The Super Model game shows a little of the backstage of this very exclusive world, in a very god way, relaxed, super-fun and with a lot of charm. You will feel how is to be a real top and make lots, lots of money and will discover some hints that can help you to "Get It" in the real life! Besides all of this, the game is recommended by Ana Hickmann, one of the Brazil and World's most famous Top Models."

It shows a model life in three stages, each different from the previous, and the objective is to be the richest model after a month being a Top Model.

Enjoy the experience of touring through one of the most scenic and exciting states in the nation, learning interesting facts about prominent people, places, sports and recreation along the way. You can impress your friends and family with what you already know. When you finish Le'Tour, you will be an expert on Colorado. We might even call you a native.

Le'Tour is designed for 2 to 40 players. It is well suited to be a team game with up to four teams of players.

Chassepot and Needlegun is a set of wargames rules for fighting battles of the Franco - Prussian War in miniature. The standard units are the infantry battalion, cavalry regiment and artillery battery. The rules also include supplemental material for the Crimean War, Franco - Austrian War, Austro - Prussian War, and the Mexican War.

link.value: And That's The Way It Was...

item.description:
* The letter-acting pair spin the spinner to select a phrase category, and select a card from either the pre-1990s or post-1990s card set.
 * The two letter actors move their bodies together to shape each letter individually to spell out the entire phrase.
 * All other players secretly guess each letter being acted, and write the letters on their word sheets.
 * When the first player in the audience correctly guesses the entire phrase being spelled, he or she yells it out.
 * The first player to guess the phrase correctly wins a point; the two letter-acting players win points.
 * Bonus points are earned for being the first player to yell out the bonus answer on the back of the card:
 o the name of the actor who played the famous character
 o the name of the character who said the famous quote
 o the artist of the song title
 o the title of the song the song lyric is from
 * The first player to score 10 points wins .
 * The Trivia Question category has a little twist - the letter-acting players must spell out the answer to the trivia question without discussing what the answer is! There is no bonus point for the Trivia Question category.

Bark Future - Where Dogs Rule and Humans Drool.

The game is set in post-apocalypse USA. The majority of the Earth’s surface has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust and mankind was largely wiped out. In their place has stepped the mutated canines who now rule the world. They are picking out a future from the dustbins of history.

Published in Games Review Monthly, June 1989, Issue 9.

For one thousand years, the home of the evil sorcerer Ardune, Amarth Bara, has been deserted until recently. Now monsters started to emerge and attack the kingdom. It only seems that Ardune has risen once more. Only 6 of the bravest knights have been summoned to investigate. All 6 entered the doors, but they never returned. All was fuzzy in their minds as they woke to find themselves lost in an endless dungeon. Now they must fight their way out and Escape from Amarth Bara

The inspector is trying to find out the murderer by doing several interrogations. Each player has one minute to explain why he isn't the murderer. He must say three words that are written in his book - all the innocents have the same three words they MUST use, but the murderer has three different words. The murderer is trying to pose as innocent by finding and using their three words, while the innocent players are trying to use the murderer's words to appear guilty.

link.value: Petits meurtres & faits divers: au tribunal

item.description:
The boards shows a tangle of streets and 40 specially marked points on these streets, which correspond to the 40-card order deck that is used for play. Besides that order deck, there is also a 12-card deck with 4 different penalty cards.

When a player has drawn an order, he must try to reach the end point within a certain number a turns, which is determined by the throw of a die. The shortest distance to the end point is the amount of chips that can be won, but failing to succeed results in loosing further turns as well as loosing chips.

Before throwing the die, each player must choose among 4 risk levels: the higher the level, the farther can his move go, but the higher is also the risk to be punished with a penalty card.

The game ends after a previously fixed amount of time and the player with the most chips is the winner.

A luxury liner hits an iceberg and begins to sink. Unfortunately, some of the world's great monsters that had been captured and placed in this boat as part of the liner's entertainment - a giant ape, a vampire, a fish-man, a wolf-man, a mummy and a man-monster - roam free now that their cages have been broken. It's up to the stalwart heroes who captured these creatures the first time, to take them down permanently. And they have to do it amongst, fleeing passengers, unsuspecting maidens and frantic crew. Oh, and before this ship sinks.

This game was the winner of a "Monster-Themed Design Contest" that Z-Man Games held on the Board Game Designer's Forum.

name.value: Naseby: The End of a Reign

item.description:
Twin of Edgehill, this one is a game on the last battle of the English Civil War fought by King Charles I before his capture and beheading. It shares with its twin brother the same gaming system and the same astonishing graphics for the map and counters art and it makes for another fast and challenging head to head game, with two armies of almost the same capabilities and strengths, that is very fun to play also solitaire in less than an hour.

Contains:
11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
120 full color counters

Print-n-Play version available at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=551

link.value: Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I
Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I

item.description:
Chronology - Sports Edition: A Card Game for All Time

Players build a time line of cards. Each card contains a sports event and the year in which it occurred. Players begin with one card each, which is placed face up in front of them. On her turn, a player is read an event from a new card; the player must then indicate the position on her own time line where the card should be placed. If she's correct she places the card in her own time line; if not, the next player gets an opportunity to win the card. The first player with ten cards wins.

The cards from this edition may be mixed with the original Chronology game to create even more combinations.

name.value: One Bad Apple: La pomme véreuse

item.description:
In this children's dexterity game, you must pick an apple from the barrel on your turn. You can either try for the big red one that's worth the most points, or try a smaller one that may be easier to pick.

Reach for the stem and lift the apple up, but be careful! If you pick it without disturbing any other apples, you get to keep it and score points. But if the apple you pick makes the wormy apple pop up it goes back into the barrel and you lose points on that turn. Then reset the game for continued play.

Fun at the Zoo is a children's game. From the side of the box:

Players choose the colored marker they wish to play and place it at the ZOO entrance. To determine playing turns, players spin the spinner one time and the player with the highest number begins first, and the other players follow in turn to the left. Shuffle the Suspense Cards and place face down in the center of the playing board.

Players spin the spinner and move forward the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner dial. At "Your Zoo" you may "Feed" some of your Zoo friends and some you may not. Upon landing on a space marked for one of your Zoo Friends, player draws one of the Suspense Cards. If the players marker is on a space marked "You May Feed" and the Suspense Card states to "Feed", player may go ahead 2 spaces. If the turned over card says "Do Not Feed" player must go back 2 spaces. By the same token, if the player marker is on a "Do Not Feed" space and the card turned over says "Do Not Feed" player may go ahead 2 spaces, but if the card says to "Feed" player must go back 2 spaces. Replace the suspense card face down under the pile after use. The first player to arrive back to the entrance wins the game!

link.value: T M Promotions Pty Ltd Australia
Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

item.description:
"Play as a sleazy computer salesman in this insanely, chaotic card/ dexterity game of sensory overload."

In Employee of the Week, there are seven working days during which the players must collect the necessary parts to fulfill as many orders as possible.

Employee of the Week is self-published by Toronto-based Steve Lefort (creator of Treasure Quest), and can be played at various Toronto Area Boardgaming Society (www.tabsonline.net) gatherings.

Employee of the Week is currently slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

Following on the heels of his extremely popular Treasure Quest, Steve Lefort brings you Xombies Attack!!!

Xombies Attack!!! is a whole new zombie experience, finally bringing you the look and feel of a classic Romero film that fits on your dining room table!

Terrain Note The terrain shown in these photos is from WorldWorksGames "Urban Mayhem"
product line. (Please note that ANY terrain will suffice for this game and this is NOT an endorsement of the WorldWorksGames Products)

In this grid based miniatures game, Xombies have overrun the city, lusting for flesh. Four very different squads must work their way through the city, fighting off hordes of Xombies while trying to reach their individual objectives. Search buildings, rescue panicked civilians, find weapons and items while avoiding nuclear obliteration. Quick paced tactics will award you victory! Recklessness will infect you with the bloodlust of the undead...

"Xombies Attack!!!" is currently under development and is slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

Card driven, hex based miniatures rules for Border Reivers and the Wars of Religion. The rules area event cards and combat is resolved either by traditional six sided dice or by using the sticker templates provided to create a set of special dice.
The object of the game is to be the first to enter the Royal Castle by winning a series of contests and challenges.

item.description:
Two states have declared war against each other. You are appointed the Supreme Commander of one of the states. Your forces: two armored, two mechanized, two airborne and five infantry divisions. How will you save your country?

Age-old strategy and the principles and weapons of modern warfare are brought together in the exciting game of Dynamiki. Based on the ancient Chinese game of Hsiangchi, Dynamiki reflects the concepts of some of history's most brilliant strategists. Match your wits against your opponent's but be prepared: tricks, twists and surprises await you at every turn.

Dynamiki is a modernized version of the age-old Chinese game of Hsiangchi whose original form is believed to be the world's earliest precursor of chess. Historical documents showed that it existed in China as early as 2400 years ago.

The pieces are: the Headquarters (building), the Capital Garrison (guard shack), Periphral Garrison (pillbox), Armored Force (tank), Motorized Infantry (gun jeep), the Airborne (helicopter), and the Infantry (soldier on foot).

Dynamiki also contains two other fast-paced, amusing Chinese games: Anki and Dakitzi, offering you a wide variety of game playing pleasure.

Anki - Combines skill and chance in an exciting and unpredictable contest of elimination.

Dakitzi - Somewhat like poker, but is more flexible and tricky, and moves much more faster.

This follow-on to Activity (1993) premiered at Essen 2000.

It is a party game for teams with progress being tracked using up to 4 pawns on the board.

One player of a team draws a card showing something from the Ruhr area of Germany. Then, depending on the card type, the player either draws on paper, silently acts out or verbally describes what is displayed on the card so that his teammates can guess it.

A sand timer determines whether the clue was achieved in sufficient time and whether the team's pawn may advance.

Usually lasts about an hour.

In this game the players are trying to solve a crime by combining different clues. The trick is which clues to use and which to discard. If you play your cards right you will be able to close the case by connecting all the five facets of the crime: Suspect, Motive, Witness, Crime scene and Traces.

The game is named after the "famous" Dutch crime reporter Peter R. de Vries.

name.value: Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps

item.description:
Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps was edited to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the publication of the Diccionari general de la llengua catalana ("Catalan Language General Dictionary") in 1932 by the linguist and Catalan language reformer Pompeu Fabra, who modernized Catalan grammar and orthography. His dictionary is widely considered a milestone in the history of Catalan language, as for the first time modern linguistic ideas were introduced in the grammar.

In the game the players together rebuild Pompeu Fabra's life and works, as well as the various social, cultural and political events that took place during his life: from his birth in Barcelona in 1868 until his death in exile at Prada de Conflent (France) in 1948. Each year in the life of Pompeu Fabra is represented by a card, and the players try to fill in the holes in the chronology, which in the initial setup is formed only by four years. The filling rules are simple and the players receive points each time a grouping of three, six or nine cards is completed.
